messages.message:
Interview Question LRU cache (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Z6qN7li2q41sH67rASCqkRecKkMHVGLtXEZ7kVjVEgE/edit#)
Noticed that some interviewers prefer candidates implement Doubly Linked List (DLL) and others allow/prefer importing existing implementations from language.
Itâ€™d be great if we can make a decision and set a guideline regarding this decision for uniformity, considering:
1. Some languages require installing packages for the same in coderpad. re: python
2. Are we testing language fluency here or algorithmic design and implementation skills (because a lot of candidates fail because they cannot resolve edge cases in DLL implementation)
Thoughts? suggestions?
We can update the doc once a decision is made here.
cc: @shaunak @Heymian @kunal @achao  @Nidhi @Erick @sudeep @Naveen
recruiting channel might be a slightly better place for this so recruiters are in the loop
